Dear Ms. Shillings:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was choked until unconscious by a peer, then spit on.
Youth A told staff of incident, but they have not done anything to
address it.
Investigation On 7/8/24 Complainant reported Youth A was being bullied at the
facility. Complainant stated that Youth A was strangled by Youth B
until he lost consciousness. Youth A had dried blood in his ear
and a spot on his nose with blood. Youth A reported the assault to
staff, but no one took action. The incident allegedly occurred
within the last three weeks.
Complainant was contacted by phone on 7/12/24 for additional
information. Complainant indicated they did not have any
additional information, as they did not witness the incident.
Complainant heard the information from another person, who also
did not witness the incident.
Foster Care Worker 1 was contacted by email on 7/8/24 and
notified of the investigation. Foster Care Worker 1 is assigned to
Youth A and reported that she spoke to Youth A’s therapist about
the incident. Therapist reported that Youth A and Youth B got into
an altercation. Youth B attempted to choke Youth A, but staff
intervened and separated the two youth immediately. Youth A was
not unconscious and did not have blood coming out of his ears or
nose.
2

DHHS Worker was contacted by email on 7/8/24 to coordinate
interviews. MDHHS Worker responded on 7/10/24, indicating an
on-call worker visited with Youth A on 7/6/24.
Youth A was interviewed by MDHHS on-call on 7/6/24. Notes
from the interview were reviewed and summarizes as follows:
• Youth A did not have any marks or bruises.
• Youth A stated that he felt safe at the facility but did not like
it there.
• Youth A stated that he is bullied by Youth B all the time.
Youth A reported that staff “write up” Youth B when he
attacks Youth A.
• Staff on duty agreed to a safety plan to keep Youth A and
Youth B separated.
DCWL Consultant attempted to interview Youth A in person on
7/15/24 and 7/18/24, but Youth A refused.
Chief Administrator was interviewed on-site on 7/12/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief Administrator was aware
of the incident where Youth A was reportedly choked. Youth A
initially refused medical attention, then chose to be seen at a later
date. Chief Administrator provided the incident report and medical
documentation.
Youth B was interviewed in person on 7/12/24 in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Youth B had been assigned one to one (1:1)
staffing since moving to the facility in June 2024. Youth B stated
he did not remember an altercation with Youth A. However, he
stated it may have been the day before the 4th of July. Youth B
stated he thought he shoved Youth A “or something”. When asked
if he ever choked Youth A, Youth B answered yes. Youth B stated
he walked up behind Youth A and put him in a choke hold, for
about one second. Staff were present and stopped them
immediately by separating everyone. Youth B recalled this
happened in the parking lot on the side of the building. Youth B
did not recall seeing any marks or injuries on Youth A. Youth B did
not recall any other fights or incidents with Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed in person on 7/12/24 in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Youth C had difficulty answering questions
due to developmental disability. However, he was able to identify
that he knew Youth A and described him as “mean”. Youth C
indicated Youth A hit him. Youth C indicated he remembered the
incident between Youth A and Youth B. However, he was not able
to answer further questions.
3

Foster Care Worker 2 was present during the interview with
Youth C and assisted in soliciting answers from him. Foster Care
Worker 2 stated that Youth C told her that staff are nice at the
facility. Foster Care Worker 2 did not have any concerns about the
care or supervision at the facility.
Health Coordinator was interviewed on-site on 7/12/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Health Coordinator did not
witness the event on 7/3/24, but she saw Youth A immediately
after. Health Coordinator did not observe any marks, bruises, or
blood on Youth A. Youth A reported that an older kid hit his head.
Youth A stated his head hurt but did not complain about his neck
having any pain. Health Coordinator planned to have Youth A
seen at Urgent Care. However, Youth A refused medical care.
On 7/11/24 Youth A was taken for a medical exam. The exam
found that Youth A did not have any marks, bruises, scratches, or
blood in his ear or nose.
Physician was interviewed by MDHHS on 8/13/24. As DCWL was
not present, MDHHS provided the following information from their
case contact. Physician saw Youth A on 7/11/24 to complete a
medical exam. Physician stated that while with facility staff Youth
A reported he was choked and passed out with bloody ears and
nose. However, once Youth A went into the room alone with the
physician, Youth A reported he had fallen and hit his neck on a rail
at the facility. Physician reported there were no marks or bruises
observed. There was no blood in Youth A’s ears or nose.
Physician reported no concerns with Youth A’s physical state.
Staff 1 was contacted by phone for an interview on 7/16/24 and
8/23/24. However, she did not respond to requests for an
interview.
Staff 2 was interviewed by phone on 8/23/24. Staff 2 stated that
the incident between Youth A and Youth B on 7/3/24 happened
very quickly and staff responded quickly. Staff 2 did not see any
marks, bruises or blood on Youth A after the incident. Staff 2
stated Youth A and Youth B are both physical with peers at times
and staff always intervene to keep kids safe.
Attempts were made to interview Staff 3 by phone on 8/12/24 and
8/20/24. However, Staff 3 did not return calls. Staff 3 is no longer
employed with the facility.
4

Video review
7/3/24 video- Youth A was talking with Staff 1, Staff 2 and Youth
C. Youth B walked away from Staff 3 and slowly walked past the
group. Youth B then suddenly ran to Youth A and grabbed him
around the neck, with his arm. Staff 1 and Staff 3 ran toward the
two youth. Youth B had a hold of Youth A for three seconds,
before dropping him to the ground. Staff 2 walked over to Youth
A, while Staff 1 and Staff 3 walked away with Youth B. Youth A
then stood up from the ground and ran toward Youth B. Youth A
hit Youth B a few times as staff separated them. Staff 1 and Staff
3 guided Youth B away from Youth A. Youth A continued to try to
go toward Youth B. Staff 2 picked Youth A up by his left arm and
right shoulder, turned around and set Youth A down. Youth A tried
to pull away but Staff 1 held Youth A’s outstretched arms for a few
seconds, then let go. Youth A walked away to the front of the
building.
Documents reviewed:
• 7/3/2024 incident report written by Staff 1. Youth A, Youth
B, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were present. Youth A and
Youth C got into an argument due to Youth C antagonizing
Youth A. Staff stood between clients to prevent contact
being made. Youth B then proceeded to run around staff,
grab Youth A and placed him into a choke hold. Staff
immediately intervened and guided Youth B away from
Youth A to prevent further incident. Youth A stated his
neck hurt, but he did not want medical attention.
• 7/3/2024 incident report written by Staff 2. Youth A and
Youth C were arguing from a previous incident. Youth B ran
behind staff and initiated a choke hold from behind Youth
A. Staff immediately began to break up the choke hold that
was being held by Youth B. Staff 2 pulled Youth A away as
Staff 3 removed Youth B and separated the two. Youth A
had red marks on the neck that were visible for about 15-20
minutes, then faded.
• 7/3/2024 Client refusal form written by Health Coordinator.
Youth A refused to go to ER for head and neck evaluation.
• 7/11/2024 Park Medical Clinic. Follow up visit for neck
injury. Physician observations- minor neck
contusion/injury, pain resolved, normal exam. Physician
recommendation- follow up as needed, no further follow up
needed.
• Case record review for Youth A and Youth B did not have
any additional information relevant to this investigation.
5

Analysis The agency is found to be in compliance as the video and witness
statements indicate that Youth A was not choked until
unconscious in the presence of staff. Additionally, staff intervened
immediately to keep Youth A safe, when Youth B grabbed him on
7/3/24.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Behavior management
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
and updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents,
their families, and referring agencies.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not follow agency policy regarding behavior
management.
Investigation In the video from 7/3/24, Staff 2 was observed picking Youth A up
by his left arm and right shoulder. Staff 2 then turned around, set
Youth A down and held his hands until Youth A pulled away.
The facility’s approved behavior management model is the Crisis
Prevention Institute (CPI) model. The technique used by Staff 2 is
not part of the approved model.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as the video showed Staff
2 did not utilize an approved behavior management technique.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024SIC0001472; CAP approved 8/19/24
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A Corrective Action Plan is required.
